snippet: The Tribune concludes a business-like article on Churches and Church-goers in the following terms: "We wish our people would think less of miner points of sectarian difference, have fewer churches, and make those they have more inviting by through...
lead_paragraph: The Tribune concludes a business-like article on Churches and Church-goers in the following terms: "We wish our people would think less of miner points of sectarian difference, have fewer churches, and make those they have more inviting by through ventilation, efficient warming in cold weather, good preaching fairly remunerated, large, effective choirs and all the proper incidents of strong societies.

headline.main: The Moral of Church-Building and Church-Going.
